data.enText: the quality of being good and of deserving praise, reward or admiration

data.chText: 具有杰出艺术价值的作品
data.enText: a work of outstanding artistic merit
The plan is entirely without merit.

data.chText: 我要凭才能得到这份工作。
data.enText: I want to get the job on merit .

data.chText: 值得赞扬（或奖励、钦佩）的特点；功绩；长处
data.enText: a good feature that deserves praise, reward or admiration

data.chText: 我们将根据每件事情本身的情况来考虑。
data.enText: We will consider each case on its (own) merits (= without considering any other issues, feelings, etc.) .

data.chText: 他们对四名候选人各自的优点作了比较。
data.enText: They weighed up the relative merits of the four candidates.

data.chText: （学校或大学考试或作业的）良好
data.enText: a mark/grade in an exam or for a piece of work at school or university which is excellent
a mark/grade given as a reward for good behaviour at school

before.enText: not used in the progressive tenses

data.enText: to do sth to deserve praise, attention, etc.

data.chText: 他声称他们不应该获得成功。
data.enText: He claims that their success was not merited.

data.chText: 这个案子不值得进一步调查。
data.enText: The case does not merit further investigation.

means: 值得赞扬(或奖励、钦佩)的特点
(学校或大学考试或作业的)良好

ex.chText: 在他的许多美德中有谦虚、勇敢和忠诚。
ex.enText: Among his many virtues are courtesy, courage and loyalty.
In fact, truthfulness is not one of her virtues.

synonyms.bx: 指某人性格中的好品质，为可数名词。

ex.chText: 在他看来，这个提议有可取之处。
ex.enText: In his opinion, this proposal has some merit.

ex.chText: 这些候选人都是凭才能被选拔出来的。
ex.enText: These candidates were selected solely on merit.

synonyms.bx: 指使某人或某物受赞扬或赞美的好品质，为不可数名词。

tr: the quality of being deserving (e.g., deserving assistance)
example: there were many children whose deservingness he recognized and rewarded
You deserve a promotion after all the hard work you have done

value.def: If something has merit, it has good or worthwhile qualities.

example.ex: The  argument seemed to have considerable merit...
example.tran: 这个论点似乎颇有价值。

example.ex: Box-office success mattered more than artistic merit...
example.tran: 票房上的成功比艺术价值更重要。

example.ex: Your feature has the merit of simply stating what has been achieved.
example.tran: 你这篇专题文章的可取之处是简明扼要地道出了取得的成就。

value.def: The merits of something are its advantages or other good points.

example.ex: They have been persuaded of the merits of peace.
example.tran: 他们被劝服，认识到了和平的好处。
一部电影技术上的长处

example.ex: It was obvious that, whatever its merits, their work would never be used.
example.tran: 很明显，无论他们的作品有何优点都永远不会被采用。

value.def: If someone or something merits a particular action or treatment, they deserve it.

example.ex: He said he had done nothing wrong to merit a criminal investigation...
example.tran: 他说自己没有干坏事，不应该受到刑事调查。

value.def: If you judge something or someone on merit or on their merits, your judgment is based on what you notice when you consider them, rather than on things that you know about them from other sources.

example.tran: 每个人都是凭个人才能入选的。

example.ex: Each case is judged on its merits.
example.tran: 每个案件都是按照案件本身的特点判定的。

value.tran: 根据事物本身的情况(来评价)

trans: 根据事物本身的情况(来评价)
